A spokeswoman from the university said there had been "a very long delay and my office is currently working through a set of feedback points it will take to make it happen. "The university is committed to the wellbeing of our students and that is why we have implemented a number of measures including a proactive monitoring of our services, an ongoing commitment to improving education outcomes, and a working relationship with the Student Association to seek advice on how to best support our students." The spokeswoman added: "We are a proud member of the UK in which we have been the best in education and if anything can be improved we would like to see higher education institutions make the best use of the resources available." The UK has had an acute shortage of primary and secondary education services in its universities, with 1.3 million students from all over the UK.
